channel.title: Interleaved RSS Feed
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from each RSS source, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: State Capitalism in Private Markets: Mission Creep
item.description: Governments relish mingling in markets. Yet, if past policies are any guide, taxpayers are being shortchanged.

item.title: Gas stove pollution harms poor and minority Americans the most, due in part to different home sizes, study says
item.description: The researchers estimated that gas and propane stoves contribute to as many as 19,000 adult deaths annually in the US, as well as 200,000 childhood asthma cases and $1 billion in societal harm.

item.title: Implementation Shortfalls Hamstring Factor Strategies
item.description: Smart rebalancing rules help portfolio managers capture more of the return that is inherent in their factor strategies. Concentrating on “priority best” trading improves factor portfolio performance.

item.title: Social-media sensation 'Shug' the zebra is recaptured after evading a rodeo clown and horse trainers to spend nearly a week on the run
item.description: Local residents and animal control officers corralled "Shug" in the community of Riverbend, about 30 miles east of Seattle.

item.title: IFRS Accounting Standard Will Support Better Investment Decisions
item.description: IFRS 18 responds to investors' concerns about challenges in comparing companies' financial performance.

item.title: Are cold plunges and saunas safe for kids? What parents need to know about the benefits and risks
item.description: More adults have been incorporating saunas and cold plunges into their wellness routines, and increasingly, their kids are, too.

item.title: Meir Statman: Your State of Mind Influences Your Investing Success
item.description: Meir Statman shares his insights on the broader aspects of financial well-being and its interconnection with life satisfaction.

item.title: The NCAA and top college conferences could pay $3 billion and share revenue with athletes to settle an antitrust lawsuit
item.description: Schools in the Big Ten, Big 12, Atlantic Coast Conference and Southeastern Conference could be on the hook for about $30 million per year, which would include about $20 million annually directed to their athletes.

item.title: Book Review: Trailblazers, Heroes, and Crooks
item.description: Stephen Foerster, CFA, extracts lessons from exceptional episodes in financial history that ordinary investors and seasoned professionals alike can put to profitable use. The bonus is that you'll be entertained from start to finish.

item.title: India and Japan hit back at Joe Biden's comments calling them 'xenophobic' countries like Russia and China
item.description: Biden made the remarks during a campaign fundraising event on Wednesday.
